the hummingbirds here are seriously awnry.

they refuse to share, and so despite having plenty of nectar for everyone, i have never once seen more then 1 feeding at a time. in fact, often they'll come and just sit in the tree next to my feeder. not drinking from it. just guarding it. if another hummingbird comes, the 1st immediately chases the 2nd one off and then they're both gone. without either having drank from it.

so, i bought a 2nd feeder thinking i could space them far enough apart to hopefully get more than 1 at a time.

i put the new one in the old spot so they'd find it and moved the old one further away.

hummingbird comes up to the new one 3 times, hovers around it, looking at it skeptically ("this is not my feeder") without even tasting. on 3rd time it finally notices where my original one went and flies over to it to drink. now they just keep coming to the old one, not even going near the new one.

really, guys?

the #hummingbirds here are seriously awnry.

rather than actually drinking all of the nectar i make for them, they mostly like to just sit in the tree next to the feeder and gaurd it so that if - god forbid - another #hummingbird should come to drink from it, they chase them away before they get a chance to.

my nectar. go away.

hmpf.

so i go out this weekend and buy a second feeder. place it in the original spot (so they know where to find it) and move the 1st to a new spot, far away. so now, if 2 come along at the same time, they can each have their very own, private feeder.

but no. not good enough.

3 times i see one fly to the old spot and just... hover... around the new one. eyeing it skeptically.

this is not my feeder.

until.... realization. oh there it is, what's it doing all the way over there?

now they just keep returning to the old one to drink and not even bothering with the new one.

well. i tried.

#birds. can't live with 'em....

i think i'm doomed to only have really ugly #bird feeders.

whenever i do something silly like go out and buy a pretty new, non-ghetto looking, one, it never goes well.

either the #birds simply won't eat from it. or, some other, non-bird wildlife discovers it and that was all she wrote.

squirrels, obviously. cred to their craftiness. the acrobatics i've seen them do to get to bird seed in the most impossible locations...it should be an olympic sport.

a raccoon completely took out a new hummingbird feeder i got a couple years ago. clearly seriously jonesing for sugar (ok, i understand that).

another time a black bear climbed over my six foot tall fence, up the trellis on my deck (stairs? we don't need no fucking stairs) to grab a brand new bird feeder i'd just filled. he picked it up with both hands, like you would a really big beer mug, and tilted it back into his mouth for like a good five minutes straight. not once coming up for air until he'd drained the entire thing.

friend at hand "pride not prejudice" 13 y/0 (bushmills), 46% abv, nc, ncf

orchard fruit on the nose with sugary sweet honeycomb, caramel and swizzles love hearts. warming mouth feel with lots of red berries and a hint of vanilla toffee, and some citrus fruit. nice hit of alcohol and a smooth sweet finish. green apples in the dregs. opens up even more with a drop of water. a quality dram.

these masks depict japanese demons, typically featuring two horns and an angry expression. these scary oni demons ward off evil spirits and protect their users from bad luck and harm. during japanese festivals, people often wear oni masks as talismans; many styles and designs exist today.

it's now 9:38pm and i'm on my way to cadis. the event was interesting. i didn't want to go because i have a zero tolerance policy with my oldest sister. she's a narcissistic idiot who would say anything outrageous to just claim your attention.

but that's me. i've been ignoring her for 15 years. i haven't seen her in that much time.

what i didn't expect is the rest of the family pretty much doing the exact same thing. my sister didn't stand her, each one of my cousins and nephews was avoiding her. every one of them had the same complains about her (she's a two-faces phony) that i have said 15 years ago.

so it was comfortable. i thought i would have to figure strategies to avoid her but i was surrounded by people that hated her so much that she didn't even try to get close.

it was amazing to be finally vindicated.

then, the event. it was so very tacky, like a new rich trying to pretend they are royalty but then doing all the wrong choices in food selection, wine, the order, the venue, every single detail was pompous but stupid.

we arrived late and at 3:30pm we haven't even had lunch yet. and upon arriving the waiters tell us we can't seat yet because we would be served snacks on the corner of the same room first, when all tables were already prepared and there was old people who couldn't stand any longer. like really poor service.

once a year we have the "bay to breakers" race famous for serious runners winning, often from africa, and serious jokesters not knowing the meaning of "win."

i live at the bottom of the infamous "hayes street hill," a gradual but relentless rise going straight up into the horizon. there are eateries and bars at the bottom of this hill. each year, hundreds of people decide this is a fine place to stop running, so much so that the city puts up a bank of porta-potties. some dinosaurs had a little too much to drink and were talking their way into the bathroom at hazie's.

one of my favorite costumes from yesteryear was "the bar," a cloth nailed to a wooden plank with cocktail glasses and shakers glued to it, the runners wearing tuxes. this pg&e crew is its spiritual descendant, and the league of their own isn't half bad either. whoever invented the alien carrying human costume made bank; they were everywhere.

the problem it that our government wants to 1. use age verification to further the surveillance state and find a way to use this opportunity to advance their panopticon projects, and 2. find a way they can leverage this to make themselves a load more personal wealth. this makes it vastly more intrusive and user hostile, and ironicly also much more difficult to do.
every time they've attempted this previously it's been deemed unworkable. will anything be different this time? hopefully not.

ok, so id "yes but only if'd" my way into puppeteering a uncooked raw chicken from the supermarket for the last burlesque on late at night (so only people looking for a place still open for booze).

he was called gilbert the glittery chicken, we covered him in glue and glitter to give him a glittery jacket, then stabbed a small real glittery bowtie into him.

i'll save you the specifics of exactly what movement abilities a raw chicken carcass has as a puppet, but we broke a bone or two in order to free things up. needless to say he had two gestures, one which seems to be showing how tall someone was with one wing, and another showing how wide something was with both wings. so he had two jokes.

we rigged it up the night before, using a wooden rod yoked over my shoulders and holes drilled through it to knot strong string through so i could move four points of articulation.

we had been told by the burlesque boss that we'd get a radio mic and when we requested it we made the mime gesture of a mic that goes over the ear (because im puppeteering) and he said "wont be a problem".

night of the show, we turn up and the boss give us a handheld cordless microphone.

and we both (conrad my clown partner and i) look at him and groan. we have 20 minutes to opening, so we string up the microphone to the yoke as well, it goes around my neck and hangs just below my mouth, check check one two, good, ok, it goes tucked into the top of my waistcoast so it doesnt dangle offputtingly (oh yes also im wearing a very dear suit to me that my mothers father owned and wore to work at the tobacco pipe factory).

so, my position is stood on stage, on a table, bent at 90 degrees, looking straight down at gilbert who is sat, as the audience enter, in a small luxurious leather armchair. he can wave at them. i cant see them, all i can hear is the door opening and see is a raw chicken and im doing a silly voice into a microphone.

and so people enter, i catch a momentary glimpse, it seems to be mostly one drunk scotsman sat beligerantly at the front, and everyone else seems to be just the various acts booked for the night. great, one person, perfect for me.

the show begins, gilbert does his warm up routine, he's based on the idea of a very long running cabaret owner, who everone has worked for one time or another, he gives everyone their first break, talks about his arch nemesis in the cabaret world, pierre the tinsel pig, and how his business had been bad of while because of all the bird flu but now (and this will date it perfectly for you) swine flu is out and its that pig's time to fry. conrad is gilbert's silent clown assistant for the night and at moments he comes up on stage bringing him a little bottle of jack daniels and pours him a glass and feeds it to gilbert. or he bastes him with some liquid. daddy needs his juice before we get the show on the road afterall.
